questions.question: She was angry ……………………….. they hadn’t invited her to their party.
……………………………… you don’t deliver the project on time, they will cancel the contract.
…………………………… he is lame, he walks with great difficulty.
questions.description: Both as and because give the reason for something.

questions.question: I will not permit this …………………………… you kill me.
questions.description: Even if refers to the future even though refers to the past.

questions.question: You cannot go ……………………….. you have finished that report.
questions.description: Either could be used here with a slight difference of meaning.

questions.question: ……………………………. she doesn’t like you, why are you still chasing her?
………………………………… I worked day and night, I couldn’t meet the deadline.
questions.description: Even though refers to the past.

questions.question: She is …………………………. beautiful that every guy in the neighborhood wants to marry her.
The higher you go, ………………………… it gets.
questions.description: The comparative is used in both clauses in this structure.

questions.question: …………………………. she is very beautiful, she has hardly any friends.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: This is the house …………………………. Lincoln was born.
